Joares May: Jaguar data exploration Part 1 Introduction

Joares May: Jaguar data exploration Chris Beirne Part 1 Introduction This workbook details the error checking and analysis for the Mato Grosso jaguars. The work will proceed in three steps. Error checking and filtering. GIS data exploration Modelling Below is a short summary of the individuals we have data for. 1.0.1 Raw data We have 34 individuals with data, with between 1 and 5 years. Most individuals are tracked for one year. name years Acerola 1 Aurora 1 Badalo 1 Brazuca 1 Brutus 1 Chuva 1 Esperança 3 Felino 1 Fera 5 Gaia 2 Garoa 1 Gatuna 1 Guarani 1 Guato 1 Isa 1 Kim 1 Leen 1 Mango 1 Mion 1 Mono 1 Nati 1 Natureza 2 Nusa 2 Oreia 1 Pandhora 2 Pirilampa 1 Rocky 1 Surya 1 Taba 1 Teorema 1 Troncha 1 Tupã 2 Vida 1 Zico 1

Part 2 Data cleaning All GPS tracking devices come with errors, and each track must be checked visually and cleaned of outliers before analysis. Furthermore, the data is stored in several different formats. We will standardize this so that everything is the same for all individuals and export a new data frame at the end. This page shows this process for each animal within the project. Animals are cleaned in alphabetical order. 2.0.1 Jaguars 2.0.2 Acerola 2022 First observation: 2022-11-02 02:03:15 Last observation: 2023-09-06 10:01:06 Active for: 308.3 days The is one clear outlier, I will filter it then re-plot the data. What is the data format?
